CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 09-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: mee eee Crl.MC.No. 7294 of 2017 () 2018/KER/988 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE A1 : TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.918/2015 OF POTHENCODE POLICE STATION, THIRUVANANTHAPURAM. ANNEXURE A2 : TRUE COPY OF THE COMPROMISE PETITION FILED BY THE 2ND PETITIONER AND 2ND RESPONDENT IN 0.P.NO.265/2016 BEFORE FAMILY COURT, NEDUMANGAD. ANNEXURE A3_ : AFFIDAVIT DATED 7.9.2017 SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENTS:NIL True Copy /P Ato Judge Piel 2018/KER/988 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No.7294 of 2017 Dated this the 9" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners stand arrayed as accused Nos.1 to 3 in Crime No.918 of 2015 of Pothencode Police Station for offences punishable under sections 500, 506, 34 and 54C of Indian Penal Code. 2. The second respondent had married the second petitioner and their matrimonial relationship got strained. Alleging various offences against the accused, crime was registered at the instance of the complainant, who is the second respondent herein and crime was registered. Pending the proceedings, accused have approached this Court to quash the proceedings. It is stated that the parties have resolved their dispute. To substantiate it, second respondent has affirmed an affidavit produced as Annexure-A3. The second respondent has reiterated that, she has no objection in quashing the proceedings. 3. On instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter was settled and the second respondent has given a statement to the investigating officer to the effect that the disputes have been settled and have decided to withdraw the criminal cases filed against each other. She has also stated that, she has no Bea ene Be 2018/KER/988 Cri.M.C.7294/17 2 objection in quashing Crime No.918 of 2015, if accused Nos.1 to 3 will not misuse the documents allegedly kept by them or used it against her and her family members. This submission was recorded and brought to the notice of the petitioners herein. Accordingly, Crl.M.C is allowed. In the light of the settlement between the parties, all further proceedings arising from Crime No.918 of 2015 of Pothencode Police Station will stand quashed, being a purely person dispute. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge Sbna/9/1/18 True Copy / P A to Judge
